alert.note: Alert for Freeborn (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 6:27PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with a history of producing funnel clouds will impact portions of Freeborn County through 715 PM CDT... At 626 PM CDT, broadcast media reported a strong thunderstorm producing a landspout near Conger, or near Albert Lea, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts. SOURCE...Broadcast media. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Albert Lea and Twin Lakes around 635 PM CDT. Clarks Grove around 645 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Glenville, Hayward, Hollandale and London. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 4 and 23. Interstate 90 between mile markers 144 and 173. LANDSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
